text: well I think eventually when you have
ideological forces that are strong that
are frustrated that they will out in the
long run um it is uh it is a a serious
problem the entrenchment of these two
parties but you know you have what 16%
support for congress today and 24% for
the Republican president I mean there's
a lot of
dissatisfaction and eventually something
will give I I'm am convinced that if you
got rid of contribution limits that you
would have these two new parties and and
it's interesting because my friend Jee
McCarthy who passed away a couple of
years ago uh used to say had the had the
1974 amendments to the federal election
campaign act been in place in
1968 when he challenged lynon Johnson of
his own party um he would not have run I
mean Jee McCarthy got $100,000
six-figure contributions from Stuart
Mott and other wealthy liberals that
allowed him to challenge Johnson and in
fact knock out a sitting president from
his own party now Jean didn't get the
nomination but he wouldn't have run he
said had those uh, limits which came out
of the 74 amendments been uh in place
then so I think uh these these limits on
contributions as long as you have full
disclosure which I'm perfectly willing
to give up even though philosophically I
don't think you should have to disclose
but okay I I think there'd be Market
pressure to disclose I think people
would say well where'd you get your
money and if you could say I got my
money from these people because they
believe what I believe and that's how
we're going to run this campaign um that
would be fine and then you'd be able to
challenge the incumbents but the way it
is now it's almost
impossible
